oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Kye Fleming & Dennis L. Morgan Interview by John Lomax III.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Kye Fleming & Dennis L. Morgan. The interview takes place on 1-15-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kye Fleming; Dennis L. Morgan
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:03) -- Introduction by John Lomax III. John Lomax asks about the song "I Was Country When Country Wasn't Cool," written by Kye Fleming. (1:14) -- Kye Fleming further explains that she wrote the song after she came up with the title. (2:10) -- Dennis L. Morgan and Kye Fleming explain the form of "I Was Country When Country Wasn't Cool." (4:03) -- Kye Fleming explains the joy of writing "I Was Country When Country Wasn't Cool." (7:53) -- Kye Fleming speaks on working with Barbara Mandrell. (10:23) -- John Lomax asks about the song "I Wouldn't Have Missed It For The World." (14:24) -- Dennis L. Morgan mentions that they wrote "I Wouldn't Have Missed It For The World," in an hour. (15:08) -- Dennis L. Morgan and Kye Fleming discuss "Sweet Yesterday" written for Sylvia. (15:45) -- Kye Fleming and Dennis L. Morgan discuss running into writer's block. (18:45) -- Dennis L. Morgan discusses writing with Kye Fleming for James Galway (flute player). The duo wrote "Memories On A Backroad" and "Dreams." (21:16) -- John Lomax asks Dennis L. Morgan and Kye Fleming how many successful #1 records they've had. (22:50) -- John Lomax asks about 1981 as a year compared to 1980 for the duo.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Fleming, Kye; Morgan, Dennis
